Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé scored once and added two assists in France's 3-0 win over Luxembourg.
Randal Kolo Muani scored the first goal for France with a header from a precise Mbappé pass.
Jonathan Clauss scored the second goal with a thunderous strike from outside the box, assisted by Mbappé.
Mbappé sealed the win with a low, first-time shot in the 85th minute.
Goalkeeper Anthony Moris denied Mbappé from close range before the half-hour mark.
Bradley Barcola made his France debut and assisted Mbappé's goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Kylian Mbappé celebrated his move to Real Madrid in style in France's win over Luxembourg.
Manager Didier Deschamps praised Mbappé as a formidable leader and highlighted his performance despite not playing much recently.
Bradley Barcola expressed pride and happiness in making his debut and contributing to the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France dominated the match, pinning Luxembourg back inside their own half for large chunks of the opening 45 minutes.
Luxembourg missed out on their first-ever major tournament with a 2-0 loss to Georgia in their Euro 2024 qualification playoff semi-final.
France play Canada on Sunday in Bordeaux in their last warm-up match before Euro 2024 starts on June 14.
France face Austria on June 17, the Netherlands on June 21, and Poland on June 25 in Euro 2024.
